snippet: America’s success at training security forces in other countries is mixed at best.
abstract: Editorial asserts that Pres Obama's plan to arm Syrian rebels, and to rely on them as ground troops in offensive against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, presents several obstacles and dangers; suggests that groups lack cohesive leadership, have dubious human rights histories, and may be more focused on their ongoing fight against Syrian Pres Bashar al-Asssad than on fulfilling American objectives.
lead_paragraph: America’s success at training security forces in other countries is mixed at best.

headline.main: A Risky Bet on Syrian Rebels
headline.print_headline: A Risky Bet on Syrian Rebels

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
